title: --miner.defaultGasPrice 0 cannot be set to 0
body:
Hello,
I've noticed that from the Ganace UI is possible to apply the defaultGasPrice to 0.

But if I run

`ganache -e 100 -l 6721975 --miner.defaultGasPrice 0 -p 7545`

On the CLI seems 0, but in fact all the tx are consuming gas. Could you check this please ?
What version of Ganache?

@davidmurdoch I run Ganache on Windows. The Ganache with the UI is the v2.5.4

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30801934/165985946-894af83e-3ea6-495f-bf74-048286c75de3.png)

The Ganache CLI version is the v7.1.0

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30801934/165986522-b0a80cfe-1514-4512-8de6-ba655d47a136.png)

I've moved to the CLI because the Ganache with an UI after 15 test approx was randomly crashing.

A `gasPrice` only works for type 0  (legacy transactions) and 1 (EIP2930 transactions), and a gasPrice of `0` is invalid after the london hardfork due to block now allowing transactions with an _effective_ gas price less than the block's "baseFeePerGas", which varies from one block to another.

You'll need to set the hardfork option to a hardfork before london (like istanbul) until we add the ability for users to specify a specific and unchanging `baseFeePerGas` option (your issue is essentially the same as the root cause of https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache/issues/1573).

@davidmurdoch man, thanks so much.
I noticed only now that was london by default!

5 stars to your real time support ðŸ’¯ 

Kudos!

Last thing @davidmurdoch , it still crash also with the v7.1.0 :(

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30801934/165988263-1e81e0e0-018b-431f-a328-ce179699f8ce.png)

If I run all the test alone are working, if I run the following command (that is properly configured)

`truffle test --network development`

Will still crash after some tests

That "Could not connect" error means there was nothing running at the given RPC URL (127.0.01:7545).

p.s., if you can past the command output text here itself it becomes searchable for others, if you paste images it is not (please paste text and use markdown code formatting when you do)

Sure @davidmurdoch 

I've used the following command and runned my ganache locally on a CLI
`ganache -e 100 -l 6721975 --miner.defaultGasPrice 0 -p 7545 -k petersburg`

And than I've run on another CLI
`truffle test`

That's it
What version of truffle?

`Truffle v5.5.12 (core: 5.5.12)`
`Ganache v^7.1.0`
`Solidity - 0.8.10 (solc-js)`
`Node v16.14.0`
`Web3.js v1.5.3`

Can you try the following (assuming you are on linux or mac, if not, you may need to make the `test` directory another way):

```bash
$ mkdir test && cd test && truffle init
```

replace contents of `truffle-config.js` with: 

```javascript
module.exports = {
  networks: {
    development: {
     host: "127.0.0.1",     // Localhost (default: none)
     port: 7545,            // Standard Ethereum port (default: none)
     network_id: "*",       // Any network (default: none)
    },
  }
};
```

start ganache:

```bash
$ ganache -e 100 -l 6721975 --miner.defaultGasPrice 0 -p 7545 -k petersburg
```

then run truffle test:

```bash
$ truffle test
```

This works for me (it can connect to ganache).

Hey @davidmurdoch , sorry for the delay.
Actually I'm on Windows, but anyways I've done all your steps.

I can connect to Ganache too, but that's crashing while doing some tests. There is a timeout ?

Just to provide more detail:
In the ./test folder there are 28 tests. It's running properly and accomplish the 13 test and than crash.

When ganache crash I get this message:

`Could not connect to your Ethereum client with the following parameters:
    - host       > 127.0.0.1
    - port       > 7545
    - network_id > 1651666299507
Please check that your Ethereum client:
    - is running
    - is accepting RPC connections (i.e., "--rpc" or "--http" option is used in geth)
    - is accessible over the network
    - is properly configured in your Truffle configuration file (truffle-config.js)

  ProviderError:
      at Context.<anonymous> (test\014_ERC721xERC721_pause_unpause_flatfee.js:37:35)
      at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)
      at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)`

If I run manually each test, one by one, is working fine.
What is the error from Ganache?

Ganache doesn't says nothing unluckily, so probably is still up.

I can see the logs like eth_accounts and so on in the CLI.

I said that Ganache crashed because Truffle was displaying the messages that I've posted in my last comment.
So it doesn't crash? I think this may be an issue on the Truffle side. Do you want me to move this issue over to that repo?

Hey @davidmurdoch ,
yes it doesn't crash because in the Ganache CLI seems up and running, so seems def. a Truffle issue.

If you could move the issue there would be great!

Hi @bruck93, nice to see you over on the Truffle side now :)

> If I run manually each test, one by one, is working fine.

Could you please provide more information about your tests? We can try to reproduce, but I suspect we'll find it easier if we have a better idea what your project setup looks like in full. If you can't share your whole project source on GitHub, could you maybe share the parts that you're comfortable with?

In the meantime, we'll add this to our list to start investigating. Thanks for reporting this!

Hey Truffle side @gnidan 
I can't share the code base of our product at the moment.

I'll discuss with the others at least if I could share some tests.
I'll follow up as soon as possible.
Hi @bruck93 . Just wondering if you are still facing this issue?

Hey @sukanyaparashar .
Yes I still have the issue.

But I've runned manually all the tests... which I didn't like honestly but was the only way
@bruck93 please send over any reproduction steps you can provide so we can help you look into this. Thanks!
I'm closing this for issue maintenance @bruck93. If you can share any information, please feel free to comment, and we'll re-open. Thanks!
